name: Robert B. Sherman
description: '''Robert Bernard Sherman''' (December 19, 1925 â€“ March 6, 2012) was an American songwriter. Best known for his work in [[musical films]] with his brother, [[Richard M. Sherman]], they, known as [[Sherman Brothers|Sherman brothers]], produced more motion picture song scores than any other songwriting team in film history. Some of their songs were incorporated into live action and animation musical films including ''[[Mary Poppins (film)|Mary Poppins]]'', ''[[The Happiest Millionaire]]'', ''[[The Sword in the Stone (1963 film)|The Sword in the Stone]]'', ''[[The Jungle Book (1967 film)|The Jungle Book]]'', ''[[The Many Adventures of Winnie the Pooh]]'', ''[[Chitty Chitty Bang Bang]]'', ''[[The Slipper and the Rose]]'', and ''[[Charlotte's Web (1973 film)|Charlotte's Web]]''. Their best-known work is [[It's a Small World|"It's a Small World (After All)"]] possibly the most-performed song (in public) in history.
